medical_history.chief_complaint: Sharp constant right upper quadrant (RUQ) pain
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Onset of pain around 4am this morning; pain is sharp, constant, and radiating to the back; associated with nausea and vomiting; no fevers; patient has never experienced pain like this before; has a history of gallstones and avoidance of fatty foods, but recently consumed high-fat content foods.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Hypertension (HTN), anxiety; past surgical history includes open appendectomy and two knee operations.
